dialogues.text: I do believe you.

dialogues.speaker: ALIEN CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: Then if you have any mercy within you, please, let me die.

dialogues.speaker: SARRIS
dialogues.text: Oh I shall, I shall... When I grow weary of the noises you make, my little plaything, he assured, you shall die... Sarris toys with his control panel. Mercifully the screen up with static and we can only HEAR the bone chilling SCR We PAN around the table, past GWEN, ALEXANDER, TOMMY, GUY mouths open in horror as they watch the screen. Camera st JASON. He stares, the blood draining from his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The actors walk quickly down the hallway behind Jason, pa

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: We're leaving, Jason. We’re leaving NOW.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Let me think. I need time to think.

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY
dialogues.text: No, Jason, that’s a wrap! There’s nothing to think about!

dialogues.speaker: GUY
dialogues.text: Listen, I’m not even supposed to BE here. I’m just Crewman #6. I’m expendable. I’m the guy in the episode who dies to prove that the situation is serious! I’m leaving NOW.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Okay... Okay... Betzalar comes running up, looking distressed.

dialogues.speaker: BETZALAR
dialogues.text: Captain...

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Betzalar, I need you to prepare pods for my crew. They’re going to return to Earth.

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: Us? What about you?  48.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: I’m staying.

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: Jason...

dialogues.speaker: BETZALAR
dialogues.text: Begging your Captain’s pardon, sir, but we cannot launch pods at the moment. Sarris will certainly detonate any objects leaving the ship. (beat) Yes sir, he’s here now. Your presence is required on the command deck. Everyone reacts, alarmed, and we cot TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The actors enter followed by Betzalar. The command deck i

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: There’s nobody here.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Betzalar, maybe we should get some of your crew up here.

dialogues.speaker: BETZALAR
dialogues.text: I thank you for your consideration to our pride, but while my people are talented scientists our attempts to operate our own technologies under simulation have been disastrous... He leans over to Gwen's computer station as she sits, and button.

dialogues.speaker: BETZALAR
dialogues.text: I have raised Sarris on zeta frequency.

dialogues.speaker: G
dialogues.text: Great. Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Still, Betzalar, your crew may nonetheless be helpful in certain- But he is interrupted by the sight of SARRIS appearing on large VIEWSCREEN. Sarris now wears a metal eyepatch, and ioeng scar across his cheek.

dialogues.speaker: SARRIS
dialogues.text: We meet again Captain. The crew stares at Sarris. He’s a frightening thing to be  49.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Yes... Hi Sarris... How are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: SARRIS
dialogues.text: Better than my Lieutenant. He failed to activate ships’s neutron armor as quickly as I‘d hoped on our last encounter. He brings into view a stake with the impaled head of his Lieutenant.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Right. Well... Listen, I’m (laughs) I’m sorry about that whole... thing.. before. It was kind of a misunderstanding. I’m sure we can work this out like reasonable people... How’s the {motions to his eyepatch) ..-that going to heal up? God, I hope so, I feel just awful about that.

dialogues.speaker: SARRIS
dialogues.text: Deliver the device now or I will destroy your ship.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Listen, I‘d like to, but frankly.. I’m not even sure where it is, or even...

dialogues.speaker: SARRIS
dialogues.text: You have ten seconds.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: All right. You got it. You win. I’1l deliver it now. Just give me a moment to set it up. Jason motions to Gwen for her to cut the transmission. Gw

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: All right, now nobody panic, I’ve dealt with this guy before and believe me, he’s as stupid as he is ugly.

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: Jason.. Jason We're going to fire everything we’ve got at him, all right?

dialogues.speaker: JASON...
dialogues.text: Jason You just keep pushing those buttons, those there, send everything at him, okay? Guy looks at the buttons. They have icons of the armament them.  50.

dialogues.speaker: GUY
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: All right. Put me back on with him.

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: I’m trying to tell you. You ARE on with him.

dialogues.speaker: SARRIS
dialogues.text: Perhaps I am not as stupid as I am ugly, Captain. Jason turns to Gwen horrified.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: I made the CUT THE LINE gesture. You nodded okay!

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: I thought it was the “We’re dead” gesture! I was agreeing! Like I know where the hold button is???

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: (nervous jovial) Listen, Sarris, you can’t blame me for trying...

dialogues.speaker: SARRIS
dialogues.text: Of course not...

dialogues.speaker: GUY
dialogues.text: Guys... Red thingy moving toward the green thingy. Red thingy moving toward the green thingy!

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: What? 7 Guy motions to the radar screen. The red blip is about to

dialogues.speaker: GUY
dialogues.text: I think we’re the green thingy.

dialogues.speaker: SARRIS
dialogues.text: A present for you, Captain.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: Shit. Turn. Gun it! Get out of- The ship is POUNDED BY A TORPEDO BLAST. Now, unlike the “ and forth” shake-the-camera explosions of the TV show, th here is jarringly BRUTAL, like side-slamming a Hummer at The entire crew goes FLYING from their positions and into walls. The lights FLICKER. They exchange glances, for the first time, bona fide FEAR eyes. This is REAL.  Sl. Then ANOTHER blast sends them crumpled against walls and like rag dolls. The pain is palpable as they try to get b their stations.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: We've gotta get out of here! Tommy looks at the sparkling map of lights on his dash.

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: Anywhere!

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Just GO! GO! DAMMIT PUNCH GO! Tommy punches the big red button. They all hold on for de as the ship roars forward, across the path of Sarris’ shi

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: They’re turning. They’re COMING. An explosion rocks the ship.

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER
dialogues.text: We are sustaining structural damage.

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: Guys, we're sustaining structural damage!...

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Faster Tommy. Get us out of here. Tommy pushes on the throttle as another explosion impacts

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY
dialogues.text: It’s as far as it goes. Guy They're still behind us... Another EXPLOSION.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: We should have a turbo. I'm always saying “activate turbo thrusters”, right?...

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY
dialogues.text: Could be this.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Push it. Hold it down. He pushes the turbo. The ship ROARS forward and begins to

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER
dialogues.text: The enemy is matching velocity.  $2.

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: The enemy is matching velocity.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: We heard it the first time!

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: Shit! I’m doing it! I’m repeating the damn computer! Suddenly an image of Dusty down in the generator room app the side viewscreen. He's taking it all in stride.

dialogues.speaker: DUSTY
dialogues.text: Hi guys. Listen, they’re telling me that the generators won't take it, the ship’s breaking apart and all that. Just FYI. The viewscreen goes black.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: We've got to stop!

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: We stop we die. Keep holding the thruster down Tommy.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: You don’t hold a thruster down! It's for quick boosts!

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Like YOU know? The ship begins to GROAN and CREAK. Then a loud KLAXON go

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: I remember that sound! That’s a very bad sound! Jason looks forward. In the distance is an amorphous hazy

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Maybe we can lose them in that cloud. They ROAR forward.

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: I don’t think that’s a cloud... As they approach, the “cloud” reveals itself to actually thousands upon thousands of SLOWLY ROTATING CUBES.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Betzalar? What is that?

dialogues.speaker: BETZALAR
dialogues.text: It’s the Tothian mine field left standing from the Great War of 12185.  $3.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: Mines? Oh lovely!

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: The ships are gaining... Jason turns to Tommy.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Do your best, Tommy... Tommy grips his controls.

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY
dialogues.text: Oh god... THE FIRST MINE HITS, ROCKING THE SHIP... BOOM! Tommy SWER avoid it, running into another mine. Then another. Tommy couldn't do worse if he were aiming for them.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: Could you possibly try (BOOM!) not to hit (BOOM!) every (BOOM!) single (BOOM!) one! (BOOM!)

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY
dialogues.text: They're drifting toward me... I think they’re magnetic!...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ship HURTLES FORWARD through the mine field, taking considerable damage as the mines impact. PIECES of the sh off behind it...

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: We're almést through... Come on... Hold... The ship is now VIBRATING HORRIBLY. It GROANS and CREAKS RIVETS start to POP! DEADLY PROJECTILES hurtling across t command deck like BULLETS.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: NO! WE’RE ALMOST THROUGH!

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: DON’T BE INSANE, STOP! FULL STOP!

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY
dialogues.text: WHAT DO I DO? WHAT Do T po? And then suddenly, a horrible METAL GRINDING noise and... vibrating stops.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: What’s happened?

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY
dialogues.text: There’s no power... The engines are dead. We're drifting. They exchange horrified glances.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Are they behind us? Gwen checks the radar.

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: No, I don’t think so... Wait. They’re not but... Something is. (beat) Oh my god. They look out the rear view screen to see... TWO DOZEN MA MINES BEARING DOWN ON THEM IN A CLUSTER.

dialogues.speaker: DOWN
dialogues.text: They barely have time to brace themselves as the ship is WAVES of explosions. They hit the floor and try to ride i It’s brutal...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The last of the mines explodes and the ship is sent tumbl lifelessly end over end through space. The exterior light dark. The once shiny hull now blackened and ragged.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The deck looks dead and empty. Smoke is in the air. The l dim. The sirens have stopped. It’s completely silent. The slowly emerges from behind panels and equipment, bruised bloodied. Jason moves to Gwen.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Are you all right? She nods, slowly rising. He turns to Betzalar.

dialogues.speaker: BETZALAR
dialogues.text: I’m fine.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Tommy? Guy?  55. They hear a GROAN. Tommy is crumpled against the wall, hi twisted impossibly. Gwen and Jason move to him. He’s in a

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY
dialogues.text: It’s broke... Oh God... Oh God... He winces in pain as Betzalar helps him to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: BETZALAR
dialogues.text: I‘ll take him to medical quarters. They exit, limping. Alexander rises, moves past Jason. Bl trickles down his forehead.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: (mocking tone) “Go into the cloud!...”

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: Alex? Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: I'm going to try to find a drink. He exits. The others turn to Jason, their faces sooty, th clothing torn and bloody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crew sits around the room, licking their wounds. Alex nurses a blue beverage. Tommy examines a high tech metall on his arm. The computer lists off an endless damage repo

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER
dialogues.text: ..-Forward thruster shaft, 87% damage... Left vector guards, 96% damage... Level 5 structural breaches in quadrants 32, 34, 40, 43, 58...

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: And the engines?

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: Computer, what about our engines? Why don’t we have power?

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER
dialogues.text: The Carbonite Sphere has fractured under stress. Damage to carbonite sphere irreparable. New source of carbonite must secured.

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY
dialogues.text: Oh great. There’s no spare on the ship?

dialogues.speaker: GUY
dialogues.text: fe didn’t have one on the show, so they don’t ere.

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY
dialogues.text: ---Hell, even my Yugo came with a spare.  56.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: (to Jason) You broke the ship! You broke the bloody SHIP! I told you you don’t hold down a turbo. You push it once, maybe twice for a boost but you Bon’ t HOLD it. Suddenly the door opens and seven Aliens enter, led by Be They look VERY SERIOUS. Guy exchanges an “uh oh” glance w Tommy... But the aliens fall to one knee, lowering their

dialogues.speaker: BETZALAR
dialogues.text: A thousand apologies. We have failed you. The actors exchanged surprised glances.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: You what?.. What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: BETZALAR
dialogues.text: We have seen you victorious in much more desperate situations. The fault must lie with us, with the ship, with our engineering...

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: No, no... It was us, Betzalar. Listen... We're... We're... We're not the people you think we are.

dialogues.speaker: BETZALAR
dialogues.text: I don’t understand...

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: Betzalar, don’t you have television on your planet? Movies? Plays?

dialogues.speaker: BETZALAR
dialogues.text: The historical documents of your culture... Yes, in fact we have begun to document our own history, from your example..

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: No not historical documents... They’re not all historical documents... I mean... Surely you don’t think Gilligan’s Island is a... Betzalar and the others exchange sad glances...

dialogues.speaker: BETZALAR
dialogues.text: Those poor people...

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY
dialogues.text: (rolls his eyes) Hoo boy...

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: Your culture doesn’t have any form of Drama? Of theater? Make believe?  s7. Betzalar and the others exchange quizzical looks.

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: Does no one on your planet behave in a way that is contrary to what they are in reality?

dialogues.speaker: BETZALAR
dialogues.text: You're speaking of the use of deception? Lies?

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: Well, sort of, I suppose...

dialogues.speaker: BETZALAR
dialogues.text: We have become aware of these concepts only recently. In our dealings with Sarris. Often we have found that Sarris will say one thing, and do another. Promise us mercy and deliver destruction. It perplexed us at first. Our people are builders, designers, we work together to create, not to destroy. These concepts of deception and lies have no worth in our society. But with Sarris, yes, we have begun to learn their meaning... at some great cost. But if you are saying that any of you could possibly have traits in common with Sarris... He starts to laugh, and the other aliens join in.

dialogues.speaker: BETZALAR
dialogues.text: You are our protectors... Our heroes. You will save us. Jason opens his mouth, but isn’t sure what to say... Sudd VIEWSCREEN lights and we see Dusty on the monitor from do generator room.

dialogues.speaker: DUSTY
dialogues.text: Hey Captain. Listen, our detectors have picked - up a source of Carbonite on a nearby planet. What do you think about the idea of rigging the aft solar distributors in a parallel matrix and configured for negative propulsion? It won't be a rocket ride, but it should get us there.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: (impressed) I... Well, uh... Yes, absolutely! Dusty turns to two young TECHS next to him.

dialogues.speaker: DUSTY
dialogues.text: Correct! Gold star for you and a gold star for you... He licks and sticks two sticky GOLD STARS on the wrists o beaming alien TECHS.  58.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ship lumbers slowly forward. In the distance we see t swirling globe of a colorful and mysterious PLANET.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason, Gwen, Tommy and Guy enter the small surface pod. Q Alexander's protege, steps forward, hands Alex a device.

dialogues.speaker: QUELLEK
dialogues.text: Dr. Lazarus, here is your surface mapper. I have programed it to the coordinates of a Carbonite Sphere of sufficient density.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: QUELLEK
dialogues.text: (emotional) Good luck on your mission, Sir. By Grabthar’s Hammer, by the Suns of Warvan I wish you-

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: (holds up a warning finger) Uh uh! What did we talk about?

dialogues.speaker: QUELLEK
dialogues.text: Right... Sorry, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy pilots the craft. Out the window the pod approaches planet. It’s an amazing sight, a blue sky with red clouds suns hang in the horizon. Guy looks out the window nervou

dialogues.speaker: GUY
dialogues.text: I changed my mind. I want to go back.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: After the big fuss you made about not getting left behind on the ship? Guy Yeah, but that’s when I thought maybe I was the crewmember that stays on the ship and something is up there and it kills me, but now I’m thinking I’m the guy who gets killed by some monster five minutes after we land on the planet. It makes perfect sense...

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Guy, you’re not going to get killed on the planet, okay?

dialogues.speaker: GUY
dialogues.text: Oh, I'm not? I’m not? Then what’s my last name?  53.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Your last name? Guy Yeah, what is it?

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: It’s... I don’t know.

dialogues.speaker: GUY
dialogues.text: No. Nobody does. Do you know WHY? Because my character isn’t IMPORTANT enough for a last name. Because I’m going to DIE five minutes in, why bother to come up with a last name for me?

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: Guy, you HAVE a last name. We just don’t KNOW t.

dialogues.speaker: GUY
dialogues.text: De I? DOI? For all you know I’m just “CREWMAN

(hysterical) Okay, it’s FLEEGMAN! Guy FLEEGMAN! There! Now I’m a whole person! I can’t die! FLEEGMAN! THEY CAN’T KILL ME NOW, CAN THEY? CAN THEY? Jason slaps him. Guy See? I’m the hysterical guy who needs to be slapped, and then I die!

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: (looks around with a sigh) Are we there yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pod makes its way toward the surface, and lands softl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone applauds, complimenting Tommy on the landing. To away, shamed.

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY
dialogues.text: Autopilot. Everyone looks away, disappointed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARD RAIN beats down on the pod. The five exit the craft around. Alexander checks his mapper.  60.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: It's this way... (they start forward) Wait... No... That way. They all turn and head the opposite direction.

dialogues.speaker: GUY
dialogues.text: You had it upside-down, didn’t you?

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: Shut up.

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY
dialogues.text: You know, with the makeup and everything, I actually believed he knew his ass from a gopher hole for a second...

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: Me too! We pull back to see the landscape around them. It’s a mar crystal formations and gleaming mountains surround them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The RAIN pours mercilessly as they move through a valley. Lightning flashes on the horizon. They continue forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They move up a moderate grade as the rain abates. Soft ea squishes under their boots. Guy locks down to see tiny BU beginning to peek up through the dirt, growing like time photography. He bends over and reaches out to touch one b opens its petals revealing... rows tiny little TEETH. And it THRUSTS forward and CHOMPS down on Guy’s finger. Guy Y trying to withdraw his finger, but it’s got a good grip.

dialogues.speaker: SEE
dialogues.text: Alexander crushes the plant underfoot, shaking his head. sucks on his bleeding finger as they continue on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They continue up a grade, and CLOUDS pass over the suns i sky, darkening the horizon.

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: More rain?

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY
dialogues.text: More something... Indeed the clouds look peculiar... Like icy crystalline s floating in the sky. Suddenly there is a crash of THUNDER begins to rain solid frozen PROJECTILES...  61. Hundreds of STALACTITES falling like knives from the sky. TACKLES Tommy, pushing him aside just as one of the proje impacts. It would have cut him in half.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Take cover! There! They all run toward a cliff face dotted with caves and overhangs.... Everyone scatters to the cave closest to th

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason and Gwen enter from outside... The room glows with green and pink crystals...

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: I guess we'll have to wait it out. They sit and watch the frozen rain fall and melt into poo outside for a long moment... Then simultaneously they get thought. They turn to each other...

dialogues.speaker: JASON AND GWEN
dialogues.text: Episode 23. “The Caverns of Delos 5.”

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: “It’s not us, Tawny... It's these caves, they have some strange power over us..."

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: “Oh, Captain, I could never reveal my true feelings until now...”

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: *Resist it, Tawny... Resist it! It’s just the cave talking! Be strong!” She moves over to him melodramatically.

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: “Kiss me Captain? Oh, please, kiss me...” They laugh at the dumb dialogue. There's an awkward pause thinks about really kissing Gwen. But she moves away befo becomes an issue.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: We always had fun, didn’t we?

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: Well they did. I’m not so sure about us...

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Oh, come on. We had good times. Remember when we mic’d Alex in his trailer? Remember the space monkey in Tommy’s locker? (a beat) Remember up in the catwalks between lighting setups?...  62.

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: Sure, on the set we were great. But off the set...

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: We had plenty of good times off the set... There was the time I... There was that time we... Remember at the beach house we...

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: Fought.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Yeah. We fought a lot. (thinks) It was me. It was my fault.

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: {surprised at the admission) Yeah? You never said that.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: It's strange, you know..? The way people treat you like your character. Even the grips and teamsters who should know better...

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: (motions to her outfit) Tell me about it.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: I know. You couldn’t wait to get out of there at wrap... But me, I would have slept in stage six if they’d let me. It was the best time of my life. The way people looked at me... Like I could do anything... I could even get someone as amazing as you to think I was special.

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: You thought it was him I wanted?...

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Truthfully... Wasn’t it? Just a little?

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: Maybe... What girl didn’t want to be with Captain Taggart? (a beat) But Captain Taggart couldn’t make me laugh. They exchange a long glance.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: That sounds like the cave talking. She laughs, proving her own point as they look out the ca entrance... A long beat as they watch the rain...  63.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: I still think we had fun off the set ONCE...

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: Well let me know if you think of it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rain has stopped... The five actors have regrouped, a trudging up a steep grade as the three suns in the sky bo the water on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: CARBONITE QUARRY
dialogues.text: They move to a cul-de-sac of large dusty boulders, exhaus parched. Alexander's device BEEPS as he approaches one fi in diameter.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: This is it.

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY
dialogues.text: I thought it was going to be little.

dialogues.speaker: GUY
dialogues.text: You never watched the show at all, did you? Suddenly they hear a sound from the darkness, a strange s half human, half animal.

dialogues.speaker: GUY
dialogues.text: That’s it. That's what’s going to kill me.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: Will you shut up.

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: Let’s get out of here before something kills Guy. They surround the boulder and start to push it the way th

dialogues.speaker: CRYSTALLINE PASS
dialogues.text: They push the Carbonite sphere forward as around them the more SPOOKY VOICES whispering in an alien tongue. And the rocks shifting; Critters climbing around the surrounding

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: I saw something move.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Me too. Let’s just keep going. They push the Carbonite past a cliff revealing a POOL of glimmering liquid. At the pool are two SMALL BLUE beings look somewhat like human CHILDREN, drinking. Everyone sta  64.

dialogues.speaker: GUY
dialogues.text: C'mon, let's go...

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: Look at them. They’re cute. They look like children... She waves at one of them. It cocks its head and waves bac

dialogues.speaker: GUY
dialogues.text: Of course they’re cufe now. But in a second they’re going get ugly and mean somehow and then when we turn around there’s going to be a million more of them... Gwen and Tommy make baby talk sounds to them. They make b sounds back..

dialogues.speaker: GUY
dialogues.text: Jesus, didn’t ANY of you guys watch the show?! Gwen smiles. The aliens smile back, imitating her... But hideous sight: Their lips curl three times wider across t faces than normal and their mouths reveal HUGE SHARP teet then notice that one of them is holding a RAGGED SEVERED has blood in his teeth. The actors hear more SKITTERING b them and turn slowly to see DOZENS of ALIEN DEMON CHILDRE appearing on the ridge.

dialogues.speaker: GUY
dialogues.text: I am so sick of being right! The demon children begin coming down the hillside in WAVE

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: God I hope they’re just coming for Guy.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: C’MON. PUSH! They push the Carbonite rock to the ridge as fast as they It’s all downhill from there, luckily... The bad news is. ..-Below they see the field of CARNIVOROUS FLOWERS now gr eight feet tall, and there are HUNDREDS of them, all snap biting at each other. -.-Jagon turns to see the STAMPEDE of the demonic aliens them like a tidal wave. He makes a decision.

dialogues.speaker: JASON

The actors follow in its pat Down the hill... straight into the FLOWER FIELD... Jason looks back to DEMON ALIENS following through the field, some getting ca into the air and eaten by the plants, but by sheer number getting through and still in pursuit. The group follows the boulder as it comes to rest at the roll the boulder onto the ramp as the DEMON ALIENS grow c But the boulder now blocks the entrance. dialogues.speaker: DEMON
dialogues.text: The hill of fire.

dialogues.speaker: DEMON
dialogues.text: It has been too long since an offering. They look down at Jason. He looks back, wary.

dialogues.speaker: DEMON
dialogues.text: Yes. Unfortunate. It is flavorful.  67.

dialogues.speaker: DEMON

dialogues.text: What should I do?

dialogues.speaker: DEMON
dialogues.text: Hit it with a rock, Demon three lifts a rock and Jason doesn’t have time to o before everything goes BLACK.

dialogues.text: There’s no time. What about that dohicky... That transports us back and forth? It’s your thing, Dusty, you know... “Molecularize me in, Sergeant Chen..." Do we have one of those?

dialogues.speaker: DUSTY
dialogues.text: The molecular conveyor...

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY
dialogues.text: Of course, we could just zap him up with the molecular conveyor! Teb?...

dialogues.speaker: TEB

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: What are we waiting for? You guys get the Carbonite Sphere up and running, okay? Teb, take us to the conveyor station. They exit running. Dusty looks a little unsure...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gwen, Alexander, Dusty, Tommy, Guy and the technician Teb the hallway. Buffing, Alexander turns to Gwen.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: You said “the Captain.”  68.

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: Back there. You said “the Captain” is down there with a bunch of cannibals.

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: No I didn’t.

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY
dialogues.text: I heard it too.

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: Is this really the most important thing we could be talking about right now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason opens his eyes to find himself outside in a rocky l He hears the sound of strange chattering and looks up to large group of DEMONS watching him through a window set i rock wall high above. The entire effect is that of a zoo a rock valley with high walls, and a number of viewing ar Above, the aliens chant a single word over and over...

dialogues.speaker: DEMONS
dialogues.text: Gorignak... Gorignak... Next to the Jason lies a wooden spear. Jason hears scratc footsteps approaching around a corner. He rises quickly a his spear. The animal appears.. It looks about the size o bellied pig, but somewhat reptilian.

dialogues.speaker: DEMONS
dialogues.text: Gorignak... Gorignak... Jason moves slowly toward the animal. It SNORTS at him, h its territory, Suddenly we hear Gwen’s voice. -

dialogues.speaker: GWEN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Jason.. Can you hear me? Jason pulls the vox from his belt.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Yes. Yes, I’m here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gwen, Alexander and the others watch Jason on a viewscree

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: Thank God. Are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Yeah.. They want me to fight this thing, Gorignak... I think I can take it though...

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: Jason, we're going to use the molecular conveyer to get you out of there. Jason pokes at the pig-lizard. It HISSES at him petulantl

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: The molecular conveyer? Wait, that’s the thing that pulls me apart into a zillion pieces zaps me up there, and reassembles me, right?

dialogues.speaker: DUSTY
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: I’1l take my chances with Gorignak. The pig lizard NIPS at Jason, getting a bite. Jason stabs

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: Jason, we’ve got to get you out of there... It's perfectly safe, isn’t it, Teb?

dialogues.speaker: TEB
dialogues.text: It has never been successfully tested.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: What? What did he say?

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: Nothing. Hold please. She switches off the vox, they turn to Teb.

dialogues.speaker: TEB
dialogues.text: Theoretically the mechanism is fully operational. However, it was built to accommodate your anatomy, not ours. Our actual hands are six fingered and jointed at ninety degrees to yours. We are unable to operate the device with the required dexterity. But now that Sergeant Chen is here he can operate it... It was designed watching his motions from the historical records. Everyone turns to Dusty. For the first time, he looks a l apprehensive. He laughs nervously.

dialogues.speaker: DUSTY
dialogues.text: Well I mean I can’t... I can supervise of course, but... Alexander turns the vox back on.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: Jason, we’re going to test it.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Okay... On what?

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY
dialogues.text: How about the pig lizard?

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Hey, I was doing okay with the pig lizard... Alexander and the others move aside to let Dusty at the c panel. The controls are complicated, and fit Dusty’s hand metal gloves. Teb GASPS as he grasps the controls.

dialogues.speaker: TEB
dialogues.text: I’m sorry. It is very exciting to see the master at the controls. The operation of the conveyer is more art than science. Dusty moves his hands and the pig is TARGETED in crosshai instrument panel. He slowly twists his wrist as he Manipu lever cautiously and.... ON THE PLANET’S SURFACE The pig lizard demolecularizes and disappears.

dialogues.speaker: CONVEYOR ROOM
dialogues.text: Everyone looks very impressed. Dusty starts to smile, “no as the pig rematerializes on the conveyer pad. As it form however, something is very wrong. We hear the pig lizard’ HORRIBLE SQUEALS over the disgusted reactions of the crew

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: What? What?

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: {singsong) Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: I heard something. A squeal.

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: Oh no. Everything’s fine.

dialogues.speaker: TEB
dialogues.text: But... the animal is inside out.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: I heard that! It’s INSIDE OUT! Then the monstrous remains of the pig lizard EXPLODES.

dialogues.speaker: TEB
dialogues.text: +.-And it exploded!

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: What? Did I just hear that it came back INSIDE OUT, and then it EXPLODED? Alex? Gwen? Hello?  71.

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: Hold on. (to others) What are we going to do?

dialogues.speaker: PLANET SURFACE
dialogues.text: Jason looks up at the viewing window where the Demons con chant.

dialogues.speaker: DEMONS
dialogues.text: Gorignak!... Gorignak!...

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Wait, the pig lizard is gone. Why are they still chanting for the pig lizard?

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: Turn on the translation circuit. Teb flicks a switch and we hear the Demons in English.

dialogues.speaker: ROCK... ROCK... ROCK...
dialogues.text: Suddenly Gwen and the others notice that the entire ROCK behind Jason moves slightly, like a granite MUSCULATURE.. facing forward, doesn’t see it.

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: Jason? I don’t think the pig was Gorignak...

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: What the hell are you talking about? Behind Jason, the boulders in the wall begin moving forwa EMERGING from the rock face, and a GIANT emerges... A MON of granite... Jason turns slowly, with a feeling of dread hears the rumbling SOUND of the monster’s body freeing it the rock face around it.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Oh darn. He takes a step back, holding his puny wooden spear. The MONSTER steps forward, 20 feet tall. Its face mostly feat yet ominous and determined and upset, and it heads straig JASON.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Guys, molecularize me in... Jason backs away slowly, around the corner, but the monst follows CRUNCH CRUNCH forward...

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Guys...7!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dusty looks genuinely distressed.

dialogues.speaker: DUSTY
dialogues.text: I can’t. You saw what happened...

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: You have to. They based it on YOUR hand movements. Dusty backs away, terror in his face... He starts talking himself nervously...

dialogues.speaker: DUSTY
dialogues.text: All my professional life they’d say “can you ride a horse” Dusty? And I’d say “Of course, been riding since I was a boy.” “Can you fence Dusty?” “Funny you should ask, I’ve won six international competitions.” I learned never to say I can’t do something. You don’t get the part if you say “I can’t do this.” So I said “sure!” because after you're cast, a stuntman does the fall, somebody’s hands play the piano for you... But this is life or death! There is no stuntman, there are no hands, so may God forgive me Jason... I can’t do this. Dusty huddles in the corner, obviously no use to anybody.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE PLANET
dialogues.text: Jason is in a FULL OUT RUN being chased by the ROCK MONST STOMPS forward, DEMOLISHING everything in its path. The D move from viewing window to viewing window excitedly, fol the pursuit. Finally Jason runs into a dead end.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: Dusty’s no good, Jason. You're going to have to kill it. The monster CRUNCHES forward, distracted by a couple of P Lizards which scurry across its path. He grabs them and p in his rock mouth, SQUASHING them. Then turns back to Jas

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: KILL IT? Well I‘m open to ideas!...

dialogues.speaker: GUY
dialogues.text: Go for the eyes. Like in episode 22 with the Var-Dragon... Or episode 46 with the-

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: It doesn’t have eyes.

dialogues.speaker: GUY
dialogues.text: The throat, the mouth... Its vulnerable spots.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: It’s a ROCK. It doesn’t HAVE vulnerable spots!  73.

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY
dialogues.text: I know... You construct a weapon. Look around, can you form some sort of rudimentary lathe?...

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: A LATHE??? Get off the line, Guy! Gwen?

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: It’s REALLY big, Jason...

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Thanks. Helpful! The monster takes a step forward, its shadow falling over

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: ALEXANDER??? PLEASE? You're my advisor, advise me! Alexander strokes his chin, thinking...

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: Jason, you have to figure out what it wants... What’s its motivation?

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: It’s a DAMN ROCK MONSTER!!! It doesn’t HAVE motivation!

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: That’s your problem. You were never serious about the craft... (closing his eyes) “I'm a rock... I just want to be a rock... Still. Peaceful.. Tranquil..* The monster goes on a frenzy, crushing everything inbetwe and Jason... Meanwhile, Alexander curls in a ball pretend the rock monster...

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: ---;"Oh, but what’s this? Something’s making noise... No, not noise, no... MOVEMENT. VIBRATIONS. Make the vibrations stop, they go straight into me like a knife!.. I must CRUSE the thing that makes the vibrations...*

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Am I crazy, or do you actually have something there? Jason reaches down and grabs a handful of small rocks. Bu moment the rock monster reaches down and GRABS him in his Jason is carried into the air and dangled above the beast Jason keeps his composure enough to toss one of the rocks DEMONS in the viewing window. The rock SMACKS the window BANG and bounces off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Demons turn to each other, smiling at this feeble eff hurt them. That is until the monster WHEELS toward the wi Jason throws another rock at the window. It hits with SOU VIBRATING the window. The monster drops Jason. Jason land throws another rock. The monster CHARGES toward the vibra and before the demons can flee, SMASHES into the viewing causing the entire wall, Demons and monster to collapse t in a mammoth landslide. All is still.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE SHIP
dialogues.text: The actors CHEER, but their relief is short lived as...

dialogues.speaker: ON THE PLANET
dialogues.text: The rock monster EMERGES from the rubble, its jaws BLOODY munching a few of the flattened DEMONS in its mouth... It to make a beeline for Jason. Jason is perplexed.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: But I’m not moving, I... Oh no. My heartbeat. IN THE ROCK MONSTER’S POV we head toward Jason and hear J adrenaline heartbeat magnified like a drum, THA-THUMP THA

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Dusty? Dusty, can you hear me?

dialogues.speaker: ON THE SHIP
dialogues.text: Dusty moves to the panel, shaking.

dialogues.speaker: DUSTY
dialogues.text: Yes Jason?

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: You've got to do this... It’s up to you. The MONSTER picks up speed toward Jason.

dialogues.speaker: DUSTY
dialogues.text: (sweat pours down his temple) No, I’1l kiil you...

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Listen Dusty. You did this for four years on the show. You can do it now... Put your hands on the controls.. Dusty puts his trembling hands on the controls...

dialogues.speaker: DUSTY
dialogues.text: I don’t know... I don’t know... The monster picks up speed. STOMP STOMP STOMP.  75.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: (hiding his fear) Dusty, I worked summer stock with Hopkins. Regional theater with Hoffman. But I swear to God I have never met an actor who could hit his mark, or nail his lines with the professional consistency of a Dustin Kwan. You're Mr. Dependable... You can do this.

dialogues.speaker: DUSTY
dialogues.text: You worked with Hopkins? I worship Hopkins. Dusty draws confidence from these words. The monster is U Jason... It raises its fist...

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: A moment of concentration - as everybody holds their brea then Dusty works the controls. Jason is STILL THERE and.. THE MONSTER SMASHES DOWN HIS FIST RIGHT DOWN ONTO JASON.. ++-at the very moment he dematerializes. The fist goes ri through the scattering molecules. Everybody on ship holds breath and watches the..

dialogues.speaker: REMATERIALIZING PLATFORM
dialogues.text: Dusty twists and turns his controls with extreme concentr Jason appears, solidifying. His body instantly DUCKS and to avoid the ROCK FIST that moments ago descended upon hi Everyone runs up to him as he regains his composure, cele hugging him and patting him on the back. Even Alexander l relieved, but won't admit it of course.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: I see you managed to take your shirt off. Jason looks over and sees Dusty still at the controls, dr with sweat. He moves to Dusty and shakes his trembling ha

dialogues.speaker: DUSTY
dialogues.text: As good as Hopkins?

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Hopkins can't drink your bathwater, Dusty. Dusty wells with pride. Jason turns to the others.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: All right folks, let’s get the hell out of here... Jason punches a communications button.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Betzalar, we’re back and we're on our way to command deck. (silence) Betzalar? (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: . JASON (cont'd). , Come in Betzalar? Teb? Queelek? Generator room?!.. What’s going on? Where is everybody? Gwen pushes a button on the monitors to see... EIGHT GIAN JUST LIKE SARRIS’ SURROUNDING THE PROTECTOR. The crew REA Gwen punches another button and a dozen video panels ligh showing... SARRIS’ MEN ALL OVER THE SHIP. IN THE GENERATO THE HALLWAYS, THE COMMAND DECK... An INFESTATION.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: We've got to get out of here. C’mon, hurry!.. But as they head toward the door, it OPENS, revealing SAR DOZEN OF HIS MEN, guns drawn. The actors back away, excep Jason who stands his ground as Sarris approaches. They st to face for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Listen Sarris, just hold on a- But Sarris BACKHANDS him brutally with his metal gloved f Jason crashes to the floor. Gwen and the others move to h are restrained by the guards. Jason starts to stand, wipi from his mouth, but with a nod from Sarris, six of his me surround Jason and begin to kick and beat him on the grou brutally... Alexander and the others can only watch in ho

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The row of barracks down the long hallway have been conve prison cells. From inside these the hundreds of captured watch in despair as JASON, BLOODY AND BEATEN, is led down corridor, his hands and feet shackled. Sarris, his guards other crewmembers follow behind. Weak and semi-conscious from the beating, Jason stumbles falls. Sarris produces a device that looks-like a cattle applies it to Jason’s neck. Jason cries out, his entire b lights up with electricity. The aliens push against the c to come to his aid, but the guards beat them back mercile through the bars.

dialogues.speaker: SARRIS
dialogues.text: If you cannot walk, Captain, then I suggest you crawl. Jason hesitates. Sarris SHOCKS him again. Jason finally r slowly begins to CRAWL forward. Everyone is silent. Numb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The area has been converted to an interrogation chamber. led in with the others. Sarris’ men are in the middle of interrogation on a man strapped to a table. They move asi reveal BETZALAR, parely alive. But as he sees Jason, a ra hope lights up behind his eyes. He smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain. Thank God you're here. Jason, despite his own pain, attempts an encouraging nod. BETZALAR (cont’d) Now you will face justice, Sarris. Sarris laughs long and hard.

dialogues.speaker: SARRIS
dialogues.text: Brilliant. Absolutely brilliant. At every turn you demonstrate the necessity for your extermination. The qualities of your race... Ridiculous optimism, like that of little children. Loyalty without regard to purpose or effect. Building, always building. But what you spend years to build, I take from you in days. What you create in decades, I destroy in moments... But you are stubborn, Betzalar, I'll grant you that. Annoyingly stubborn. (to Jason) Do you want to save this man's life, Captain? And the life of your crew?

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: SARRIS
dialogues.text: Then tell me one thing... What does it do, the device? The Omega 13.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: I... I don’t know. Sarris twists a dial. Betzalar writhes in pain on the tab

dialogues.speaker: SARRIS
dialogues.text: Is it a bomb? Is it a~booby trap? Tell me!

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Stop, please! I don’t know! Sarris twists the dials even higher.

dialogues.speaker: SARRIS
dialogues.text: Guards! Prepare a tear harness for the female...

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: No! I don’t know! I swear I don’t know! I can’t tell you!

dialogues.speaker: SARRIS
dialogues.text: Do you think I’m a fool? That the Captain does not know every bolt, every weld of his ship? Gwen fights the guards valiantly as they drag her to a ta

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: But I’m not! I... I’m not the Captain! Sarris turns, interested. He motions his guards to halt.

dialogues.speaker: SARRIS
dialogues.text: Wait. What did you say?

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Please, don’t hurt them, it’s not their fault. I‘m not the Captain, I don’t know anything. Betzalar looks at him too, bewildered. Sarris looks intri

dialogues.speaker: SARRIS
dialogues.text: Explain.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Gwen. The show. There’s no choice... Do it.

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: (a long beat) --.Computer, play the historical records of the GALAXY QUEST missions. A screen lights up with the opening of the first GALAXY Q episode. We see the various actors in their roles, freeze in action poses, intercut with the ship speeding through Sarris watches, captivated. Realization dawns on his face begins to laugh. Sarris turns to Betzalar, beaten and ble hope lighting in his eyes as he watches the show. That ti Sarris even more, he ROARS with laughter.

dialogues.speaker: SARRIS
dialogues.text: Oh, this is wonderful. Wonderful. I treated you as a foe, but no... You have done much greater damage to these poor fools than I ever have..> Than I ever could.... Bravo!... Bravo! He puts his arm around Jason and leads him to face Betzal

dialogues.speaker: SARRIS
dialogues.text: Tell him. This is a moment I will treasure. Explain to him who you really are. Jason looks up at Betzalar. A long pause.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: My name is Jason Nesmith. I’m an actor. We’re all actors.

dialogues.speaker: SARRIS
dialogues.text: Our dim witted friends don’t understand the concept of acting. They have no theater, no imagination these scientists...

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: We pretend...

dialogues.speaker: SARRIS
dialogues.text: Simpler.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: We.. We lie.

dialogues.speaker: SARRIS
dialogues.text: Yes... You understand THAT, don’t you, Betzalar?... Betzalar looks up at Jason, bewildered.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: I’m not a Captain, there is no United States Exploration Administration. There is no ship.

dialogues.speaker: BETZALAR
dialogues.text: (perplexed, points to Tv) But there it is!...

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: A model, only as big as this. (motions with his hands)

dialogues.speaker: BETZALAR
dialogues.text: But... Inside, I have seen-

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Just sections of rooms made of plywood. Our Carbonite Sphere was painted wire and plaster. The molecular conveyor was Christmas lights... Decorations.

dialogues.speaker: BETZALAR
dialogues.text: But... why?

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: It’s difficult to... On our planet we pretend in order to... entertain. Betzalar just stares. Sarris watches, eyes twinkling.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: That’s how I make my living. Pretending to be somebody else. Pretending to be Captain Peter Quincy Taggart... (beat) I’m... I’m so sorry Betzalar... Betzalar looks away, his eyes hollow, all hope gone.

dialogues.speaker: SARRIS
dialogues.text: (to Betzalar) Now you know. This entire world you've concected. Your miserable lives, all based on nothing. Your beliefs... your hopes... All a dream. A wisp of smoke. Now there is only pain. Sarris moves to his Lieutenant, RAK LATHE.  80.

dialogues.speaker: SARRIS
dialogues.text: Lieutenant Lathe, I confess that I am beginning to feel a bit foolish myself. Chasing across the universe to obtain what is, I am now certain, a bauble of fiction. But just in case... Tell me how best to obliterate this vessel? I would like nothing to remain.

dialogues.speaker: LATHE
dialogues.text: The core could be hardwired to overload without much effort.

dialogues.speaker: BETZALAR
dialogues.text: Sarris. What about my men?

dialogues.speaker: SARRIS
dialogues.text: Yes, you're right. Much too easy a death for the trouble you have caused me. Lieutenant, open a vent on level “C” and let the outside in a bit for our friends downstairs. A beat. Enraged, Jason LUNGES for Sarris, but his men qui him down brutally.

dialogues.speaker: SARRIS
dialogues.text: I guess an actor is not the same as a Captain after all. He turns to his guard, motioning to Jason and the others.

dialogues.speaker: SARRIS
dialogues.text: Release them, Sergeant... Into space. The Guard nods and escorts them out. Sarris turns to Betz raises the torture control with a sick smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A number of Sarris’ men jettison cargo through a hydrauli airlock. The crates floats into space, collected by a fre ship outside. They look up as the computer makes an annou

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Core overload. Emergency shut down overridden. Core implosion estimated in nine minutes... Jason and the others enter, escorted by the guards who mo the workers to leave them alone. Then Guard #1 pushes a b opening the cargo hold. He motions to Alexander and Jason

dialogues.speaker: GUARD
dialogues.text: Lift out the crate and get in. Jason and Alexander move to the cargo hold. Alex glares a

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: Well, how does it feel, Jason? Was it worth it? They lift the crate aside. Jason simply hangs his head.  81.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: Hundreds of innocents to die because of you... How does it feel?

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Shut up. Just shut up.

dialogues.speaker: GUARD
dialogues.text: Be quiet, both of you. Get in. The guard lifts his gun. Alexander and Jason slowly walk the cargo jettison scoop.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: Hundreds dead, all so you could play at being the Captain!

dialogues.speaker: GUARD
dialogues.text: Be quiet.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: You've murdered us all you egomaniacal sonofabitch!

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Shut up! Just shut up you green skinned freak! Alexander LUNGES at Jason, striking him in the face. They to the ground, fighting. The guards smile, enjoying the f Jason quickly overpowers Alexander and punches him repeat own anger taking hold. Finally, he lifts Alexander to his Alexander’s eyes are rolled back in his head. Jason pulls the crowning blow... .--and deals a punisher right past Alexander into the fac Guard #1! Alexander’s eyes snap open and he ELBOWS Guard the face. The fight was an act. The second guard’s gun go SKITTERING into the cargo scoop as he drops unconscious. dives into the scoop to retrieve the gun, aims at Jason a the trigger at the instant the scoop hydraulics comes to he is WHISKED THROUGH THE HOLD INTO SPACE, flailing silen the vacuum. Everyone turns to see Dusty taking his finger cargo button.

dialogues.text: Hmmm.. A bit sticky. 1’11 get one of my boys up here with a can of WD-40. Alexander turns to Jason, both out of breath.

dialogues.text: “Green skinned freak...?”

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: I was staying in character. “Egomaniacal sonofabitch?”

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: Naturalism. I see you got to win the fight... ‘

dialogues.text: I had the shot...

dialogues.text: Guys... She motions to a row of security monitors... One labeled “ENVIRONMENTAL SYSTEMS DECK - C LEVEL” shows SARRIS’ MEN straining at a large circular valve. On anoth Monitor we see DEBRIS rushing up to a vent in the BARRACK AIR_IS SUCKED OUT OF THE ALIENS’ PRISON. Teb and the othe pull on their prison bars in horror.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Let’s go.

dialogues.text: Core implosion in four minutes...

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Go on, give it a try, Gwen.

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: Computer, shut down the core.

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER VOICE
dialogues.text: Unable. Memory checksum for core operations invalid. Systems hardware damaged.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: All right guys, listen up. Gwen and I are going to have to get to the core and shut it down manually. Tommy, you and Dusty need to get that - air valve back on. Alex, see if you can get the prison doors open downstairs in case Tommy and Dusty can’t get the oxygen back in time.

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY
dialogues.text: Jason? What about me? What do I do? Jason puts a hand on his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Practice driving, Tommy. They all split up, leaving Tommy standing there.

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY
dialogues.text: Practice driving?  83.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gwen and Jason hurry down the hallway, keeping a look out Sarris’ guards.

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: So... We get to shut down the neutron reactor?

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: Uh... I hate to break it to you Jason, but I don’t know how to shut down a neutron reactor, and unless you took a Learning Annex course I don’t know about, I’m pretty sure you don’t know how to shut down a neutron reactor either.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: No I don’t. But I know somebody who does. INT. BRANDON’S HOUSE - TARZANA - EARTH - DAY Birds chirp outside pleasantly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room of our #1 GALAXY QUEST fan, BRANDON. The fourtee old sits at his computer, in uniform, gluing a tiny piece plastic to his model of the Protector. A knock on the doo his mother enters. BRANDON’S MOM Brandon?

dialogues.speaker: BRANDON
dialogues.text: Mother, I’m quite busy as you can see. The “C” rings on my booster unit came broken _in the mail. BRANDON’S MOM I’m sorry. I made rice crispy squares.

dialogues.speaker: BRANDON ,
dialogues.text: Mother, I'm very busy. Well, maybe one. Thank you. She exits. Brandon looks at his model with a sigh. Sudden hears a familiar TONE. He cocks his head and turns to... THE INTERSTELLAR VOX sitting on his table. He starts to t away, but it BEEPS again. Slowly he reaches out, takes it hand and flips the switch. We hear Jason's voice.

dialogues.speaker: JASON, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hello?... Hello is anyone there?... Brandon stares at the thing, then looks around his room f of a practical joke. He speaks into it quietly.  84.

dialogues.speaker: BRANDON
dialogues.text: «+ -Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason, holding his VOX, nods to Gwen... “Got him.”

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: This is Jason Nesmith. I play Captain Peter Quincy Taggart of the USEA PROTECTOR. INT. BRANDON’S ROOM Brandon stares at the vox for a very long moment like tho on the old Candid Camera show when the mailbox talks to t

dialogues.speaker: BRANDON
dialogues.text: .--Yes?

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: We accidently traded Vox units when we bumped into each other on Saturday. You got mine.

dialogues.speaker: BRANDON
dialogues.text: Oh... Oh, I see. Oh.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: What's your name, son?

dialogues.speaker: BRANDON
dialogues.text: Brandon.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Brandon, I remember you from the convention, right?... You had a lot of little technical observations about the ship, and I spoke sharply to you...

dialogues.speaker: BRANDON
dialogues.text: Yes, I know, and I want you to know I thought about what you said... I know you meant it constructively but...

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: It’s okay. Listen-

dialogues.speaker: BRANDON
dialogues.text: ++-But I want you to know that I am not a complete braincase, okay? I understand completely that it’s just a TV show. There is no ship, there is no Carbonite Sphere, no molecular conveyor... I mean, obviously it’s all just a-

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: It’s real, Brandon. All of it, it’s real.  8S.

dialogues.speaker: BRANDON
dialogues.text: (no hesitation) I knew it!... I KNEW it!...

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Brandon... The crew and I are in trouble and we need your help. The look on Brandon's face is indescribable. His entire l built to this moment. He straightens in his seat at atten eyes glistening.

dialogues.speaker: BRANDON
dialogues.text: Yes sir. How can I be of service, sir?

dialogues.text: One moment... Sarris moves to turn on a viewscreen. Behind him, Betzala the table, unconscious.

He pushes a b a panel moves aside revealing a complete library of the G QUEST episodes... Like a high-tech shrine. Tommy moves hi across the selections, picking one episode in particular smile...

dialogues.text: Sir, it’s you! Thank Ipthar!  86.

dialogues.text: Come with me. I’11 explain on the way.

dialogues.speaker: . JASON
dialogues.text: Okay, we're in the storage bay. What now? INT. BRANDON’S BEDROOM - CONCURRENT Brandon inserts a GALAXY QUEST CDROM labeled TECHNICAL SY into his computer. A couple of clicks later, a 3D wire fr diagram of the ship appears.

dialogues.text: There’s no hatch. (losing faith) There’s no hatch!

dialogues.text: Wait... Jason, Here!... The hatch is hidden by a large piece of scrap equipment. Jason push the metal out of the way leading to the hatch.

dialogues.text: Okay, we got it.

dialogues.text: Okay, you can go on in... I'm going to get Kyle. He knows the utility tunnel system better than anybody alive. INT. BRANDON’S BEDROOM - CONCURRENT Brandon punches some keys and Kyle pops up in a little CU window on the computer.

dialogues.text: No time for pleasantries, Kyle. We have a level five emergency. The Captain needs us to get him to the core and shut it down before it overloads.

dialogues.text: Oh, okay.

dialogues.text: You've got the utility systems walkthrough, right?

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: I’m not downloading porn! He clicks <cancel> on the picture. INT. SHIP’S CORRIDOR SECTORS 30-50 Dusty and Guy make their way down the corridor, checking numbered sectors as they pass.

dialogues.text: Okay, sector 38... 39... 40. This is it. The environmental systems are in here. Ali we have to do is shut off the valve to the barracks... They look through the window into the room to see... A HU Sarris’ men sitting inside, surrounding the large circula that controls the valve. Dusty exchanges a look with Guy. Guy All we have to do...

dialogues.text: Tommy sits at the desk watching an episode of GALAXY QUES the screen. The scene has Tommy piloting the ship, dodgin weaving through a very silly giant paper mache monster fl space.  88.

But Tommy is dead serious. He watches himself on the tape mimicking his own piloting moves, pretending that the miscellaneous objects on the table are his controls... An synching his lines as his character says them on TV...

dialogues.text: Jason and Gwen run through the tunnel system, following B instructions.

dialogues.speaker: BRANDON
dialogues.text: Okay, now left at the next turn... You should see the crystalline oxygen units. Make a right there. Then go through the antimatter vent...

dialogues.text: Okay... Okay, now what?

dialogues.speaker: BRANDON
dialogues.text: Now make a right, you’1ll see a doorway that opens on the central manufacturing facility. The bowels of the ship. Gwen and Jason turn right and their eyes widen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dante’s Inferno. Down below, a huge automated facility fo construction and maintenance. Moving elevators and convey move through a maze of scaffolding and overhangs. Glowing of molten metal run past giant swinging hammers and prong arms and crushing machines.

dialogues.speaker: BRANDON
dialogues.text: Captain, do you have a camera? I'd die to see this in person... All they showed on TV was a machine here, and a wall here... I don’t know why they didn’t show the whole thing.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: (awed) We'd never have the budget for this.

dialogues.speaker: BRANDON
dialogues.text: Okay, so do you see a door marked “CORE UNIT?” Should be down at the far end to your left. On the other side of the room, down a circuitous path thr dangerous gauntlet of machinery and lava Jason spots such

dialogues.text: Yes...?

dialogues.speaker: BRANDON
dialogues.text: Okay, that's where you want to be. Gwen and Jason look at each other, then... Giggle nervous just so impossible.  89.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alexander and Quellek arrive at the “prison area” hatch a through the window... In their cells, many of the aliens already unconscious. Others valiantly attempt to open the with crudely constructed levers and battering rams, to no

dialogues.text: They’re dying! Alexander inserts his hand into the ID pad.

dialogues.text: Open. Open dammit. A light flashes. “Pressure lock override” Alexander turns wall console.

dialogues.text: Here. Help me tear this down, we can use it as a battering ram. Quellek follows Alexander to the console, looking over hi shoulder at the prison. Alexander puts his hand on his sh

dialogues.text: Don’t worry, Quellek, it’1l be okay... Quellek seems comforted, but Alexander isn’t too sure him

dialogues.text: Dusty and Guy continue to watch Sarris’ men, still surrou main valve.

dialogues.text: We've got to get that valve turned off. Their oxygen is almost gone...

dialogues.text: Listen, I’1l go in, create a distraction. I have this... (holds up the gun) I may be able to hold them back long enough for the aliens to escape.

dialogues.text: It’s suicide.

dialogues.speaker: GUY
dialogues.text: I’m just a glorified extra, Dusty. I’m a dead man anyway. If I’m going to die, I’d rather go out a hero than a coward.

dialogues.speaker: DUSTY
dialogues.text: Maybe you’re the plucky comic relief, Guy. You ever think of that?  90. Guy cocks his head. No, he hadn’t thought of that. Dusty shoulder.

dialogues.text: Besides, I just had a really interesting idea... INT. SARRIS’ SHIP TO SHIP TRANSPORT Sarris stands at the observation window as the transport way toward his ship. All but one of the other ships have area, and that ship is turning and heading toward a black the distance... The TRANSPORT CHIEF next to him gets a message on his ear

dialogues.text: Sir, the FALCON THREE is launched and away, course set for Xactor Minor. FALCON ONE dead ahead. Four minutes to core overload.

dialogues.speaker: SARRIS
dialogues.text: Good... Good... All is in its place.

dialogues.text: ..-General, I have just received word that the Captain of the PROTECTOR and his command crew have escaped custody. Their whereabouts are unknown,

dialogues.text: What? Suddenly a LIFELESS BODY CRASHES against the windshield l bug. It’s Sarris’ Guard, jettisoned earlier. Sarris’ eyes

dialogues.text: Find them.

dialogues.speaker: LATHE
dialogues.text: But sir, my MEN. The core explosion is not reversible...

dialogues.speaker: SARRIS
dialogues.text: Find then.

dialogues.text: Jason and Gwen make their way along a narrow catwalk abov manufacturing floor. A row of ROBOT ARMS block their way, erratically. They have to dodge the arms to move forward.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Okay, we've cleared the robot arms. Now what? INT. BRANDON’S ROOM Brandon now has his whole CREW on separate windows of his screen, including fan KATELYN, wearing a “Tawny Madison”  gl.

dialogues.text: Okay, Brandon, as I calculate it the shortest route is down the ladder near the quark accelerators.

dialogues.speaker: OTHER NERDS
dialogues.text: I concur. She’s right. Very good.

dialogues.speaker: BRANDON
dialogues.text: High five, Katelyn. He and the others hi-five, slapping their computer screen

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason and Gwen make their way down the ladder, and across beam over a LAVA POOL at a staggering height.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Brandon.. Just in case I die, there’s something I have to know...

dialogues.speaker: BRANDON
dialogues.text: Yes Captain?

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: What does the Omega 13 do?

dialogues.speaker: BRANDON
dialogues.text: Well, that’s the big the question, isn’t it?

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: BRANDON
dialogues.text: It’s been the subject of an extremely heated debate on the internet for years. Many believe that is a matter collapser, a bomb capable of destroying all mattér in the universe in a chain reaction lasting 13 seconds.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: But you don’t?

dialogues.speaker: BRANDON
dialogues.text: No, I am of the firm belief that in reality it is not a matter killer, but a matter REARRANGER, converting all molecules to the exact state they existed thirteen seconds previous to activation thus effecting a thirteen second time jump to the past.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: How did you come to that conclusion?

dialogues.speaker: BRANDON
dialogues.text: My cousin's boyfriend’s sister went out with the screenwriter. His favorite movie is The Omegaman. He’s seen it 13 times...  92.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: As you know I strenuously disagree with this theory, Brandon. If all molecules were rearranged, then everyone would be back in time 13 seconds rendering the device useless. Suddenly a BLAST erupts next to Jason’s head. He and Gwen see SARRIS’ MEN shooting at them from across the room at entrance to the cavern.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Okay guys... Guys? But the nerds are now caught up in the debate.

dialogues.speaker: KATELYN
dialogues.text: No because the brain of the person who triggers the Omega 13 is not affected, so THAT person still has his memory after the time jump.

dialogues.speaker: BRANDON
dialogues.text: Thank you, Katelyn. Excellent.

dialogues.speaker: KATELYN
dialogues.text: (flattered, shy) You’ re welcome, Brandon. Jason and Gwen RUN as Sarris men continue to shoot at the

dialogues.speaker: BRANDON
dialogues.text: Yes Captain... All right, you’re almost there. Just go through the chompers and over the pit.

dialogues.text: “The chompers?” They turn to see... THE CHOMPERS... An unavoidable gauntl HISSING HYDRAULIC SMASHING METAL HAMMERS AND BLADES jutti from the sides, top, bottom and diagonally...

dialogues.text: Oh, screw THAT. More GUNFIRE from Sarris’ men. Another BLAST melts a pole them. Jason pulls his disrupter pistol and fires back at Sarris’ men take cover.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Brandon, HOW? INT. BRANDON’S ROOM Brandon cradles a telephone on his shoulder.

dialogues.text: Hollister, do you have the sequence yet?  93. INT. HOLLISTER’S ROOM Another one of Brandon's pals, HOLLISTER, watches a tape show, fast viewing one sequence backwards and forwards ov over; ON THE TV, we see the cheap painted cardboard version of crushers. dialogues.text: Gwen and Jason watch as they SMASH and GRIND back and for

dialogues.text: Gwen...

dialogues.text: We shouldn’t have to DO this! It makes NO LOGICAL SENSE! Why is it HERE?

dialogues.text: Because it was on the show!

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Okay, now. But-

dialogues.speaker: BRANDON
dialogues.text: Wait two seconds then go. Another BLAST from Sarris’ men weakens the catwalk behind  94.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: No, wait, are you-

dialogues.text: Lt. Madison, GO.

dialogues.text: Shit! Go!

dialogues.speaker: BRANDON
dialogues.text: GO Captain. Jason and Gwen run through the CHOMPERS. It is a series o ESCAPES, timed just a FRACTION late, so at one point Gwen all her strength to pull a SLEEVE caught in the works bef second hammer comes down where her body was a moment befo DIVES through a quickly diminishing hole, his DISRUPTER P falling behind him, quickly SMASHED to oblivion by a clos

dialogues.speaker: BRANDON
dialogues.text: Up.

dialogues.text: Berithium lava coming through. Use the handholds above you. Here comes the lava down a chute ahead of them. Jason pul up just as the lava comes through, sizzling the tips of h hanging hair.

dialogues.text: This should be interesting... ON THE MOLECULAR CONVEYOR DISPLAY: We see crosshairs targ object... The vague outline is that of a man, but blocky misshapen... We recognize it as THE ROCK MONSTER... Dusty

dialogues.text: DOZENS OF SARRIS’ MEN continue to surround the oxygen val suddenly THE ROCK MONSTER materializes right in the middl room! They look up in horrified disbelief, a surreal sile one of Sarris’ stunned men CLICKS his transmitter button. monster WHEELS on him in an instant, picking him up and c him flat between its jaws. Then MAYHEM as Sarris’ men TRA each other trying to escape from the room.

dialogues.text: Dusty and Guy watch the mayhem on a monitor, admiringly.

dialogues.speaker: DUSTY

dialogues.text: The MONSTER chases a group of Sarris’ men down a dead-end Sarris’ men have nowhere to go as the monster bears down and CRASHES through the hull, taking himself and everyone INTO SPACE. Inside, the far doors shut automatically to c the vacuum.

Alexander la Quellek’s head to the ground softly, then rises. There is intensity to him we haven’t seen before... His eyes BURN. Alexander moves into the hallway, fixing his attention on man. The guard tries to reload his gun but his eyes locked on Alexander like a frightened animal and his cart clatter to the ground. Alexander ROARS like a creature, b his teeth in the final moments... The guard stands there meets his death, so terrified he can only mutter a single  98.
